title: More of a statement than a question
content:
Sorry that this is not a question but more a statement that I hope will resonate with Google.
I've used the Galaxy Nexus, Nexus 6P, Pixel 1 and now the Pixel 3.  I won't be coming back anytime soon as I feel that I have been ripped off and I find it really sad.

1- The phone was really expensive...so I was expecting very high quality peformances.

2- The phone has slowed down more than any other phones that I have owned and it has not even been a year since I bought it.  It's not incredibly slow by any means but has lost a significant amount of 'buttery smoothness' and I do not overload my phone at all.

3- Battery life is average at best...some days are quite horrendous

4- Network reception seems worse than my S8 that I had before.  I get drop calls, it has a hard time finding LTE when it should not be an issue...wifi calling works only sometimes and I need to reboot the phone to make it work again.

5- The back design is great but not the front and the speakers do not sound really good (as pointed out in many reviews).

For the first time, I am in a hurry to finish my 2 years contract...and I can't really consider finishing it before as the phone is so damn expensive.

I know that Google has many clients and I'm sure I'll get some hate for posting this but I'm sure I'm not alone and I only hope that futur buyers will have a better experience then my Pixel 3 experience... (with the Pixel 4, etc)
